inputs.name: overrideParameters
inputs.label: Override parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Type the parameters to override in the textbox. To edit the override parameters in a grid, click on “…” next to Override template parameters text box. Example,
–storageName fabrikam –adminUsername $(vmusername) -adminPassword $(password) –azureKeyVaultName $(fabrikamFibre).
If the parameter value you're using has multiple words, enclose them in quotes, even if you're passing them using variables. For example, -name "parameter value" -name2 "$(var)"
To override object type parameters use stringified JSON objects. For example, -options ["option1"] -map {"key1": "value1" }.

inputs.name: [ExampleOfHelpMarkdownForParameterToEnableAuthentication]
inputs.label: [ServiceName] Authorization
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A list of [Identity Type](link-to-related-docuementation) that will allow to grant data plane permissions on Service Items Each element of the array is a hashtable that must meet the following schema:
  • **`"objectId"`**' : '*`"string"`*. The Email, Display Name or Object Id of the Azure AD principal to be granted with permissions
  • **`"permissions"`**` : `*`{hashtable}`*. A hashtable with the following elements:
    • **`"keys"`**` : `*`"string"`*. The permissions to be granted to the [Key Vault keys](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/key-vault/about-keys-secrets-and-certificates#key-access-control) (`get`, `list`, `update`, `create`, `import`, `delete`, `recover`, `backup`, `restore`, `decrypt`, `encrypt`, `unwrapKey`, `wrapKey`, `verify`, `sign`, `purge`, `all`)
    • **`"secrets"`**` : `*`"string"`*. The permissions to be granted to the [Key Vault secrets](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/key-vault/about-keys-secrets-and-certificates#secret-access-control) (`get`, `list`, `set`, `delete`, `recover`, `backup`, `restore`, `purge`, `all`)
    • **`"certificates"`**` : `*`"string"`*. The permissions to be granted to the [Key Vault certificates](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/key-vault/about-keys-secrets-and-certificates#certificate-access-control) (`get`, `list`, `update`, `create`, `import`, `delete`, `recover`, `backup`, `restore`, `managecontacts`, `manageissuers`, `getissuers`, `listissuers`, `setissuers`, `deleteissuers`, `purge`, `all`)
    • **`"storage"`**` : `*`"string"`*. The permissions to be granted to the [Managed Storage Account](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/key-vault/about-keys-secrets-and-certificates#storage-account-access-control) (`get`, `list`, `update`, `delete`, `recover`, `backup`, `restore`, `set`, `regeneratekey`, `getsas`, `listsas`, `deletesas`, `setsas`, `purge`)
E.g. of valid value: `[`    `{`       `"objectId" : "r.lopez@servexternos.repsol.com",`       `"permissions" : {`          `"keys" : ["Get", "List"],`          `"secrets" : ["Get","List"],`          `"certificates" : ["Get","List"],`          `"storage" : []`       `}`    `},`    `{`       `"objectId" : "4fc0433b-f6a1-4a90-b5f6-b59ac591d0f8",`       `"permissions" : {`          `"keys" : ["Get","List"],`          `"secrets" : ["List"],`          `"certificates" : ["All"],`          `"storage" : []`       `}`    `}` `]`

inputs.name: [ExampleOfHelpMarkdownForParametersRelatedToFirewallAllowMicrosoftServices]
inputs.label: [ServiceName] Firewall -  Allow Microsoft Services
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Allows [trusted Microsoft services](link-to-related-documentation) to bypass the firewall. Trusted services include:
  • Azure Virtual Machine Deployment Service
  • Azure Resource Manager Template Deployment Service
  • Azure Disk Encryption volume encryption service
  • Azure Backup
  • Exchange Online
  • Sharepoint Online
  • Azure Information Protection
  • Azure App Service: Web App
  • Azure SQL
  • Azure Storage
  • Azure Data Lake Storage

inputs.name: [ExampleOfHelpMarkdownForParametersRelatedToFirewallAllowedPublicIPs]
inputs.label: [ServiceName] Firewall - Allow Public IPs
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Grant access to traffic from specific public [internet IP address ranges](link-to-related-documentation) Each element of the array is a `string` that must meet one of the following formats:
  • Single IP (e.g. `"195.53.125.0"`)
  • CSV of IPs (e.g. `"195.53.125.0,195.53.125.120"`)
  • CIDR (e.g. `"195.53.125.0/24"`)
  • Range of IPs (e.g. `"195.55.119.5-195.55.119.60"`)
E.g. of valid value: `[`    `"195.53.125.0",`    `"195.53.125.0,195.53.125.120",`    `"195.53.125.0/24",`    `"195.55.119.5-195.55.119.60"` `]`

inputs.name: [ExampleOfHelpMarkdownForParametersRelatedToFirewallAllowedSubnets]
inputs.label: [ServiceName] Firewall - Allow Azure Virtual Networks
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Grant access to traffic from specific [Azure virtual networks](link-to-related-documentation) Prerrequisites:
  • The Virtual Network subnet must have the [`Azure Key Vault` service endpoint enabled](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-network-service-endpoints-overview)
  • The Deployment Service principal must have the RBAC permission [`Microsoft.Network/JoinServicetoaSubnet` granted on the Virtual Network subnet](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/resource-provider-operations#microsoftnetwork)
Each element of the array is a hashtable that must meet the following schema:
  • **`"VNetSubscriptionId"`**` : `*`"string"`*. The subscription of the Virtual Network to be allowed
  • **`"VNetResourceGroupName"`**` : `*`"string"`*. The Resource Group of the Virtual Network to be allowed
  • **`"VNetName"`**` : `*`"string"`*. The name of the Virtual Network to be allowed
  • **`"VNetSubnetName"`**` : `*`"string"`*. The name of the Subnet to be allowed
E.g. of valid value: `[`    `{`       `"VNetSubscriptionId" : "0a25214f-ee52-483c-b96b-dc79f3227a6f",`       `"VNetResourceGroupName" : "EngineeringServiceTests",`       `"VNetName" : "testreleasevnet",`       `"VNetSubnetName" : "testreleasevnet"`    `},`    `{`       `"VNetSubscriptionId" : "0a25214f-ee52-483c-b96b-dc79f3227a6f",`       `"VNetResourceGroupName" : "testsubnet10tests",`       `"VNetName" : "testvnet",`       `"VNetSubnetName" : "testsubvnet"`    `}` `]`

inputs.name: {ServiceName}SecretsAuthorizedServicePrincipals
inputs.label: Authorized Service Principals (Secrets Key Vault name : {StorageAccountName}kv)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The list of Service Principals that will be allowed to access the Storage Account related secrets on the Key Vault with name `{StorageAccountName}`kv.

Each element of the array is a `string` that will contain the Service Principal Display Name, Object Id or Application Id to be granted with access.

E.g. of valid value:
`[`
   `"Repsol_VSTS_RepsolCCC01_CCC_12168da9-ce0c-4768-af91-475b517438f6_z0euw1edmrsg041",`
   `"56407ba6-803e-4c9c-a61f-44c757b30f06"`
`]`

inputs.name: {ServiceName}SecretName{Secret1}
inputs.label: Secret name - {Secret 1} (Default secret name: SA-{ServiceName}-Key1)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
{Short description with links to Azure doc}.

If empty, the name of the secret will be `SA-{ServiceName}-Key1`.

inputs.name: {ServiceName}OutputKeyVaultName
inputs.label: Key Vault name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of the Key Vault where the output variables will be stored as Key Vault secrets.

If empty, the variables will be written only as Azure DevOps pipeline variables.

inputs.name: {ServiceName}OutputVariable{Output1}
inputs.label: Variable Name - {Output 1} (Default name: CCCOutput-wst-{WindowsAppServiceName}-OutboundIpAddresses)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
The name of the variable where the [Outbound IP Addresses](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/overview-inbound-outbound-ips#when-outbound-ips-change) will be stored.

If empty, the name of the variable will be `CCCOutput-wst-{WindowsAppServiceName}-OutboundIpAddresses`.

The variable will be created as an [Azure DevOps release variable](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/release/variables?view=vsts&tabs=powershell#set-in-script). If a Key Vault has been given, it will also be created as a Key Vault secret.
